title: Foundation: O/Ls and Mechanical Aptitude
description: A pass in G.C.E. O/L, particularly with good results in Maths and Science, is the entry point. A genuine interest in automobiles and how they work is the most important prerequisite. Starting as a helper in a local garage provides initial exposure.

title: Vocational Training (NVQ Level 4)
description: Enroll in a formal Motor Vehicle Mechanic course at a technical college. This structured training is essential for learning the theory and professional practices of vehicle maintenance and repair, leading to a recognized NVQ qualification.
qualifications: NVQ Level 4 in Motor Vehicle Mechanic

title: Automobile Technician
description: Work as a technician in a dealership's service center or a modern independent garage. You will perform routine servicing, diagnose faults, and carry out repairs on various vehicle systems according to manufacturer standards.

title: Senior Technician / Diagnostic Specialist
description: Become a senior technician, trusted with the most complex diagnostic challenges. This is the stage to specialize in a specific area like hybrid and electric vehicles, advanced vehicle electronics (ECUs), or a particular brand (e.g., German or Japanese cars).
institutes: Brand-specific training centers run by major dealerships

title: Workshop Foreman / Own Garage
description: Progress to a management role as a Foreman or Service Advisor, where you supervise other technicians, interact with customers, and manage workshop operations. Alternatively, with a strong reputation and client base, you can open your own modern garage.
